name: Rome Marriott Grand Hotel Flora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I recently stayed in the Marriott flor as part of our honeymoon. I chose the hotel as I wanted to use my marriott points and as a result th stay was free. I have a marriott platinum card so our room wa upgraded to a junior sweet with a very large outdoor trrce. The room was great and much better than I was expecting for a free rewards stay.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is served on a roof top terrace with some of the most spectacular view of Rome you can expect short of climbing St Peters. the breakfast was comprehensive with a huge choice, including champagne.
reviews.title: A little disappointed in the Grand Flora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The loction was very good, with lots of to end hotels and embassys on th ame street as well as a host of expensive places to eat. Bus & trin stations are 7 minutes walk away and there is actually a metro station accross the road from the hotel but we never used it so I don't know how good it was.
reviews.title: great hotel, superb staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were profssional as can be expected by Mrriott lthough the surly head porter would often give priority to suit & tie businessmen over the tourists.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a great hotel and a very enjoyable place for an umarket city break
reviews.title: Elegant, old world charm in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora with our two teenage daughters. We were guests for a week, and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. The beds were a bit firm, but comfortable. Our gold status in Marriott Rewards qualified us for free breakfast in the rooftop restaurant, which had a very lovely panoramic view of Rome. We enjoyed the breakfasts, but they are probably not worth the high charge that the hotel charges for those not receiving breakfast as part of their package.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the location of the hotel. The Via Veneto is no longer as "chic" as it was around the time of Fellini's "La Dolce Vita" - but it is a lovely street with many hotels. Across the street on the corner of the Villa Borghese is an entrance to the Metro, Spagna stop. Although access involves a long walk through many subways/tunnels, it is reasonably busy and we used the metro at all times without concern. Also, there's a full-service supermarket in the subway at the base of the escalators, and we purchased very reasonable sodas, water, and snacks there that we kept in the room.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurants ON Via Veneto are expensive, but around the corner to the left of the hotel are many more reasonable eating places. Our personal favorite was Pomodorino on Via Campania (to the right as you exit the Marriott).
reviews.title: Luxuriousness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given side-by-side rooms, as there are NO connecting rooms are available at the hotel. This is an important fact, since the people at Marriott USA had told us when we made reservations that connecting rooms WERE present in the hotel. This is not the case.
reviews.title: Marriott Points or Bust!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is really my only complaint, and should be clarified between Marriott international sites and Marriott Reservations in the US.
reviews.title: Vintage Marriott Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Grand Flora. We are Gold Elite Marriott Rewards members and Marriott timeshare owners, so we stayed for free on points. Our room was pretty spacious for European standards. We enjoyed the free breakfast each morning, which was the most extensive breakfast we had throughout our travels in Italy. We dined in both the area on the top floor with a gorgeous view of Rome and at the dining room on the first floor. It was nice as well.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Grand Flora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great. They made restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. There is free internet access available on two computers they have off the lobby. You just have to sign a form at the front desk.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Nice area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was convenient. We did a lot of walking as well as riding the train and occasionally some cabs. The area around the hotel was pretty and safe. The hotel was quiet, clean and had air conditioning.
reviews.title: Not worth it, even on points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would recommend it to others and stay again when in Rome.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but probably won't stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: TIP: This is a popular hotel and it’s hard to find rooms available on Marriott.com when trying to book with points. I had success booking with points by simply calling the hotel directly. They have more availability than what is listed online.
reviews.title: Pretty hotel, but no business center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service in the hotel is just amazing, during our whole stay. Very very helpful staff and concierge. The rooms are small, very small, but neat, clean and quiet. The hotel is located in a posh road near nice cafes, park and attractions.
reviews.title: Great Marriott Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 4 nights at the Marriott Grand Flora, on points. I am a Marriott platinum member, and was able to get upgraded to an Executive Suite through the help of a Marriott employee. I have never stayed is such a grand and large suite, and everything about it spelled high class. Worthy of 5+ stars!
reviews.title: Ultra-Luxurious!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location was perfect - next to the gardens and to 2 metro stations. One of the stations has an underground pathway with an entrance next to the hotel. The pathway also houses a supermarket store, which is very convenient. We mostly used the other metro station, as it was a nice downhill walk from the hotel. Some people mentioned that the restaurants close to the hotel are very expensive. I would disagree, although it depends on what you call expensive. There is a mix of mid-to-high end restaurants. We did not eat at the super expensive lounges, but some of the restaurants and pizzerias were reasonably priced, given the high-end locality. We walked to the Spanish steps and to trevi fountains area from the hotel during the evenings. Both were close by and the walk was pleasant.
reviews.title: Unforgettable Italian vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our reservation, and it was excellent! Great variety and selection of breads, eggs, juices, pastries, etc. Fantastic views of the city from the roof-top. I doubt you can get a better selection of continental breakfast and view of the city from any other hotel.
reviews.title: As Luxurious As Its Going to Get!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Unlike other reviews, I found the staff extremely client focused and helpful. We sought help from the staff on a number of occasions for locations, recommendations, directions, etc. and were provided with good insights and suggestions. I forgot my laptop plug-point adapter in Florence, and they lent me one free to charge.
reviews.title: Very nice but it seems to be a bit over valued.

description: Rome Marriott Grand Hotel Flora - il cuore di Via Veneto batte in altoImmerse in your personal "Dolce Vita" at the Rome Marriott Grand Hotel Flora, right on top of the noble Via Veneto and next door to the Villa Borghese gardens.This gracious edifice with the stylish decor capturing the grandeur of Neoclassicism is exclusively designed for those looking for refined luxury in an atmosphere of sophistication and the highest level of welcoming hospitality anticipating every need of today's business or leisure traveller.Just sink back in the timeless elegance of the superbly appointed rooms and relax, or delight in the culinary highlights of the Mediterranean cuisine at the restaurant The Cabiria. The adjoining bar is the ideal place to meet, to see, or be seen, or to take in the flamboyant atmosphere of Via Veneto.The rooftop Ailanto is the perfect setting for wedding receptions and exclusive celebrations, or simply for admiring the enchanting view over the roofs of the Eternal city.Rome Marriott Grand Hotel Flora - right on the top.
